<h4 style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Description</h4>

<!-- <h4 style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Before running the SMR function </h4><br> -->

This function summarises many background files. It is most useful when in need to summarise background respiration that was measured for longer period of time (many measurement cycles). It becomes useful when trying to better understand system-wide respiration rate, across all channels. For example, it may be used to explore the variability of background respiration rates between different respirometry chambers,or to explore overtime changes in backgrounds respiration. This is shorthand way to get background MO2 <a style="color:grey">mgO2/L/min<a> through `MMR_SMR_AS_EPOC` function.

_Note: this is a developing function_

<h4><a style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left" name="Arguments">Arguments</a></h4>

  Argument       | Description | Default
---: | :------------- | :---
**data**        | Data file _..._analyzed.csv_ of respiration. | --
**Ch**          | Specify Channels for analysis. A numeric vector. | --
**resp.ID**     | A character vector with respiromtery IDs. | --
**resp.Vol**    | A numeric vector of respirometry volumes. | --

<br><h4><a name="Value" style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Value</a></h4>

<h5 style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left; text-indent:+10px;"><i class="fas fa-ellipsis-h"></i>&nbsp; Data outputs</h5>

1. .csv files
* ()_BACK_SLOPES.csv
  - Saved in local directory
  - Metrics included: Channel ID, temperature, R~2~ (min, max, mean), slopes (min, max, mean), the number of measurements, the ID and volume of respirometer, and the datafile name. 
2. _.png files_
* ()_ChX_backSlopes_PLOT.png (X = the number of channel)
  - All files saved in the local directory
  - Frequency plot of all background respiration slopes for each channel.


<br><h4><a name="Details" style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Details</a></h4> <br>

One file is analysed at the time, writing a loop to analyse all files in a given directory will be handy. 


<br><h4><a name="Example" style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Example</a></h4> <br>


<pre class = "sourceCode yaml"> 

 sum_backgr(data = "jul04_2019_box4_back_post_dummy_analyzed.csv",
            Ch = c(1,2,3,4),
            resp.ID = c("A", "B", "D", "E"),
            resp.Vol = c(1.5, 1.5, 1.5, 1.5))

</pre>
